DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Low [33]
        Medium [66]
        High [100]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [100]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Speed [SSPD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Low [33]
          Medium [66]
          High [100]
    Set Direction [SDIR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Query [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Can you set the ceiling fan to medium speed and reverse its direction?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The fan speed can be set to Off, Low, Medium, or High, with Medium corresponding to 66. The direction can be Forward (0) or Reverse (1). The accepted commands to change these are Set Speed (SSPD) and Set Direction (SDIR), each requiring the appropriate enum parameter.

To set the fan to medium speed, send the command SSPD with parameter Medium (66). To reverse the direction, send SDIR with parameter Reverse (1).

Result: Execute SSPD(Medium) and SDIR(Reverse) to set the fan speed to medium and reverse its direction.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Float
      Range 30.0 to 75.0
      Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Float
      Range 0.0 to 10.0
      Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30.0 to 75.0
        Unit °C
    Power On [DON]
    Power Off [DOF]
    Query [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
I want to lower the water heater temperature to 45 degrees Celsius and turn it on. How do I do that?

I first identify the relevant properties and commands. The water heater temperature can be set between 30.0 and 75.0 °C using the Set Temperature (STEMP) command. Power status can be controlled with Power On (DON) and Power Off (DOF).

To lower the temperature to 45 °C, send STEMP with parameter 45.0. To turn the heater on, send DON.

Result: Execute STEMP(45.0 °C) followed by DON to set the temperature and power on the water heater.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Integer
      Range 0 to 100
      Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open [DON]
    Close [DOF]
    Set Position [SPOS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100
        Unit %
    Query [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Could you set the window blind to 75% open and check if it is responding?

I analyze the device structure: the Position property ranges from 0 to 100%, with 0% meaning closed and 100% fully open. The accepted command to set position is SPOS with a parameter from 0 to 100.

To set the blind to 75% open, send SPOS with parameter 75. To check if the device is responding, look at the Responding property which can be True (0) or False (1).

Result: Send SPOS(75) to set the blind position, then query the Responding property to verify device responsiveness.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***

      Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1.0 to 10.0
        Unit °C
    Open Door [DON]
    Close Door [DOF]
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Query [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Please set the refrigerator temperature to 4.5 degrees Celsius and make sure the door is closed.

Reviewing the device structure, the refrigerator's internal temperature can be set between 1.0 and 10.0 °C using the Set Temperature (STEMP) command. Door status can be controlled with Open Door (DON) and Close Door (DOF).

To set the temperature to 4.5 °C, send STEMP with parameter 4.5. To ensure the door is closed, send the Close Door (DOF) command.

Result: Execute STEMP(4.5 °C) and then DOF to set the temperature and close the door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

    Stop Irrigation [DOF]
    Set Schedule [SSCH]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          On [1]
    Query [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Can you start watering the garden and enable the irrigation schedule?

From the device structure, the irrigation controller can be turned on or off using Start Irrigation (DON) and Stop Irrigation (DOF). The schedule can be enabled or disabled with Set Schedule (SSCH) command, which accepts Off (0) or On (1).

To start watering, send DON. To enable the schedule, send SSCH with parameter On (1).

Result: Execute DON to start irrigation and SSCH(On) to enable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

      Parameter 1: []

USER QUERY:
I want to turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high. What commands should I use?

The device properties show that the fan speed can be set to Low (1), Medium (2), or High (3). The accepted commands to control power and fan speed are Power On (DON) and Set Fan Speed (SFAN).

To turn on the purifier, send DON. To set the fan speed to high, send SFAN with parameter High (3).

Result: Execute DON to power on and SFAN(High) to set the fan speed to high.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Garage Door Opener
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Battery Level
      Integer
      Range 0 to 100
      Unit %
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [DON]
    Close Door [DOF]
    Stop Door [DSTOP]
    Query [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Is the garage door open? Also, can you stop it if it is currently opening or closing?

First, I check the Door Status property which can be Closed (0), Open (1), Opening (2), or Closing (3). To determine if the door is open, verify if the status equals Open (1).

If the door is currently Opening (2) or Closing (3), the Stop Door (DSTOP) command can be used to halt movement.

Result: Query the Door Status. If it is Open (1), confirm the door is open. If status is Opening (2) or Closing (3), send DSTOP to stop the door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Please set the pool heater temperature to 28 degrees Celsius and turn the heater on.

The pool heater's water temperature can be set between 15.0 and 40.0 °C using the Set Temperature (STEMP) command. The heater can be turned on or off with Turn Heater On (DON) and Turn Heater Off (DOF).

To set the temperature to 28 °C, send STEMP with parameter 28.0. To turn the heater on, send DON.

Result: Execute STEMP(28.0 °C) and then DON to set the temperature and power on the heater.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Oven
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Integer
      Range 50 to 300
      Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Bake [1]
        Broil [2]
        Roast [3]
    Timer
      Integer
      Range 0 to 180
      Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 50 to 300
        Unit °C
    Set Mode [SMODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Bake [1]
          Broil [2]
          Roast [3]
    Set Timer [STIME]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180
        Unit minutes
    Start Oven [DON]
    Stop Oven [DOF]
    Query [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
How do I set the oven to roast mode at 220 degrees Celsius for 45 minutes and start it?

The oven's temperature can be set between 50 and 300 °C using Set Temperature (STEMP). The mode can be set to Off, Bake, Broil, or Roast using Set Mode (SMODE). The timer can be set from 0 to 180 minutes using Set Timer (STIME). To start or stop the oven, use Start Oven (DON) and Stop Oven (DOF).

To fulfill the request, send SMODE with Roast (3), STEMP with 220, STIME with 45, then DON to start.

Result: Execute SMODE(Roast), STEMP(220 °C), STIME(45 minutes), and then DON to start the oven.
